1→# Claude Agentic Framework
     2→
     3→> Transform Claude Code into an elite autonomous engineering platform with 95% token savings, 20 skills, 33 agents across 3 model tiers, persistent memory, and hybrid security.
     4→
     5→## Overview
     6→
     7→The **Claude Agentic Framework** is a comprehensive autonomous engineering platform that upgrades Claude Code from a single-agent assistant to a sophisticated multi-agent orchestration system. It provides skills, agents, hooks, commands, and persistent knowledge infrastructure for context engineering, agent coordination, continuous review, and autonomous execution.
     8→
     9→### What You Get
    10→
    11→- **15 Comprehensive Guides** covering everything from basic context engineering to advanced multi-agent patterns
    12→- **21 Ready-to-Use Commands** for delegation, orchestration, planning, worktrees, and more
    13→- **33 Agents across 3 Tiers**: 4 Opus (planning/security), 17 Sonnet (implementation), 12 Haiku (validation)
    14→- **20 Skills** for the full engineering lifecycle (review, test, security, refactor, scaffold, TDD, and more)
    15→- **5 Hook Namespaces**: damage-control, mastery, observability, framework (knowledge/review/guardrails/testing), prompt-hooks
    16→- **Knowledge Pipeline**: SQLite FTS5 persistent memory for cross-session learning
    17→- **Continuous Review**: Automated post-commit analysis with findings database
    18→- **Hybrid Security**: Pattern-matching + LLM semantic validation (prompt hooks)
    19→- **Multi-Model Tiers**: Right model for the right task (50-60% cost savings)
    20→- **Git Worktree Management**: Parallel development across branches
    21→- **Installation Scripts** for one-command setup and removal
    22→
    23→### Key Benefits
    24→
    25→- **95% Token Reduction**: Strip permanent context, load only what's needed
    26→- **50-60% Cost Savings**: Multi-model tiers assign Opus/Sonnet/Haiku per agent
    27→- **Infinite Scalability**: Delegate heavy tasks to isolated sub-agents
    28→- **Persistent Memory**: Knowledge database survives across sessions
    29→- **Crash Recovery**: Context bundles restore sessions instantly
    30→- **Autonomous Execution**: Z-Threads run from prompt to production with zero human intervention
    31→- **Continuous Review**: Automated code review on every commit
    32→- **Hybrid Security**: Pattern + LLM semantic hooks prevent destructive operations
    33→- **Real-Time Monitoring**: Mission Control dashboard for multi-agent observability
    34→- **Anti-Loop Guardrails**: Prevent agents from entering infinite loops
    35→
    36→## Table of Contents
    37→
    38→- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
    39→- [Installation](#installation)
    40→- [Architecture Overview](#architecture-overview)
    41→- [Core Concepts](#core-concepts)
    42→- [New in 2026](#new-in-2026)
    43→- [Security](#security)
    44→- [Commands Reference](#commands-reference)
    45→- [Skills Reference](#skills-reference)
    46→- [Step-by-Step Guide](#step-by-step-guide)
    47→- [Performance Benefits](#performance-benefits)
    48→- [Configuration](#configuration)
    49→- [Testing](#testing)
    50→- [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
    51→- [Advanced Patterns](#advanced-patterns)
    52→- [Contributing](#contributing)
    53→- [Changelog](#changelog)
    54→
    55→## Quick Start
    56→
    57→### Installation
    58→
    59→```bash
    60→# Clone the repository
    61→cd ~/Documents
    62→git clone https://github.com/yourusername/claude-agentic-framework.git
    63→cd claude-agentic-framework
    64→
    65→# Run the installer
    66→./install.sh
    67→```
    68→
    69→The installer will:
    70→1. Backup your existing `~/.claude/` configuration
    71→2. Symlink all commands, agents, skills, guides, output-styles, and hooks
    72→3. Generate `settings.json` from template (hooks, prompt hooks, permissions)
    73→4. Create runtime directories (`data/knowledge-db/`, `data/logs/`, `data/tts_queue/`)
    74→5. Set executable permissions on all hook scripts
    75→6. Validate the installation
    76→
    77→### Your First Agentic Session
    78→
    79→```bash
    80→# Start Claude Code (context is NOT auto-loaded, saving tokens)
    81→claude
    82→
    83→# When you need project context
    84→/prime
    85→
    86→# Delegate heavy research to a sub-agent
    87→/research "authentication patterns in FastAPI"
    88→
    89→# Restore a crashed session
    90→/loadbundle latest
    91→
    92→# Orchestrate multi-agent task
    93→/orchestrate "Build a REST API with authentication"
    94→```
    95→
    96→## Installation
    97→
    98→### Prerequisites
    99→
   100→- **Claude Code CLI** (version 0.1.x or higher)
   101→- **Python 3.10+** and **uv** (for hook scripts)
   102→- **Node.js 18+** (for Mission Control dashboard)
   103→- **Bun** (optional, for Mission Control server)
   104→- **Git** (for installation)
   105→
   106→### Standard Installation
   107→
   108→```bash
   109→# Clone the repository
   110→git clone https://github.com/yourusername/claude-agentic-framework.git
   111→cd claude-agentic-framework
   112→
   113→# Run installer with backup
   114→./install.sh
   115→```
   116→
   117→### What Gets Installed
   118→
   119→The installer symlinks from the repo into `~/.claude/`. Source of truth stays in the repo.
   120→
   121→```
   122→Repo structure (source of truth):
   123→├── global-agents/               # 15 root agents + team/ + agbot/
   124→│   ├── orchestrator.md          # Lead coordinator (Opus)
   125→│   ├── researcher.md            # Research specialist (Sonnet)
   126→│   ├── rlm-root.md              # Root controller (Opus)
   127→│   ├── project-architect.md     # Project analysis (Opus)
   128→│   ├── critical-analyst.md      # Critical thinking (Opus)
   129→│   ├── meta-agent.md            # Agent file generation (Sonnet)
   130→│   ├── team/                    # Builder, Validator, Project Skill Generator
   131→│   │   └── guardrails/          # 8 guardrail agents
   132→│   └── agbot/                   # 8 domain-specific agents
   133→├── global-commands/             # 21 slash commands
   134→│   ├── prime.md, research.md    # Context & delegation
   135→│   ├── orchestrate.md, fusion.md # Multi-agent
   136→│   ├── plan.md                  # Planning
   137→│   ├── create-worktree.md       # Git worktrees
   138→│   └── refine.md, build.md      # Development
   139→├── global-skills/               # 20 auto-discoverable skills
   140→│   ├── knowledge-db/            # Persistent memory (SQLite FTS5)
   141→│   ├── multi-model-tiers/       # Model tier configuration
   142→│   ├── code-review/             # Automated review
   143→│   ├── tdd-workflow/            # Test-driven development
   144→│   ├── security-scanner/        # Security scanning
   145→│   ├── video-processor/         # Video/audio processing
   146→│   └── ... (14 more skills)
   147→├── global-hooks/                # 5 hook namespaces
   148→│   ├── damage-control/          # Pattern-matching security
   149→│   ├── mastery/                 # Lifecycle tracking
   150→│   ├── observability/           # Monitoring & metrics
   151→│   ├── framework/               # Knowledge, review, guardrails, testing
   152→│   │   ├── knowledge/           # Knowledge pipeline (8 modules)
   153→│   │   ├── review/              # Continuous review (analyzers + engine)
   154→│   │   ├── guardrails/          # Anti-loop protection
   155→│   │   ├── testing/             # Hook test framework
   156→│   │   └── validators/          # L-thread + test validators
   157→│   └── prompt-hooks/            # LLM semantic validation docs
   158→├── global-output-styles/        # 11 output format styles
   159→├── global-status-lines/         # Status line versions
   160→├── guides/                      # 15 engineering guides
   161→├── data/                        # Runtime data
   162→│   ├── knowledge-db/            # SQLite knowledge database
   163→│   ├── model_tiers.yaml         # Centralized tier config
   164→│   └── logs/                    # Runtime logs
   165→├── templates/                   # settings.json template + L-thread
   166→├── apps/observability/          # Vue 3 dashboard + Bun server
   167→├── docs/                        # Upgrade guides & migration docs
   168→├── install.sh                   # Symlink installer
   169→└── uninstall.sh                 # Clean removal
   170→```
   171→
   172→### Uninstallation
   173→
   174→```bash
   175→# Remove all installed files and restore backup
   176→./uninstall.sh
   177→```
   178→
   179→## Architecture Overview
   180→
   181→The framework implements a layered architecture:
   182→
   183→```
   184→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   185→│                    USER INTERFACE                        │
   186→│              (Commands: /prime, /research, etc.)         │
   187→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   188→                           │
   189→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   190→│                  PRIMARY AGENT (You)                     │
   191→│     - Minimal context (5k tokens)                        │
   192→│     - Coordination only                                  │
   193→│     - Delegates heavy work                               │
   194→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   195→                           │
   196→        ┌──────────────────┼──────────────────┐
   197→        │                  │                  │
   198→┌───────▼──────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐
   199→│  RESEARCHER  │  │ ORCHESTRATOR │  │  RLM ROOT    │
   200→│   Sub-Agent  │  │ Coordinator  │  │  Controller  │
   201→└──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘
   202→                           │
   203→        ┌──────────────────┼──────────────────┐
   204→        │                  │                  │
   205→┌───────▼──────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐
   206→│  Builder     │  │   Tester     │  │   Designer   │
   207→│  Sub-Agent   │  │  Sub-Agent   │  │  Sub-Agent   │
   208→└──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘
   209→                           │
   210→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   211→│              PERSISTENCE LAYER                           │
   212→│   - Context Bundles (session snapshots)                  │
   213→│   - Progress Files (L-Thread state)                      │
   214→│   - Mission Control DB (observability)                   │
   215→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   216→```
   217→
   218→### Key Architectural Principles
   219→
   220→1. **Thin Primary Context**: Keep main agent context under 10k tokens
   221→2. **Delegate Heavy Work**: Sub-agents consume tokens in isolation
   222→3. **Persistent Intelligence**: Bundles and progress files survive crashes
   223→4. **Hierarchical Coordination**: Orchestrator manages agent fleets
   224→5. **Programmatic Memory**: Search + read_slice instead of full-context loading
   225→
   226→## Core Concepts
   227→
   228→### 1. Context Engineering (Step 1-2)
   229→
   230→**Problem**: Loading full project context permanently wastes 2,500+ tokens per session.
   231→
   232→**Solution**: Strip global context, prime on-demand only when needed.
   233→
   234→```bash
   235→# Old way: Context auto-loads every session (wasteful)
   236→# New way: Load only when needed
   237→/prime
   238→```
   239→
   240→**Savings**: 10-20% permanent token reduction
   241→
   242→### 2. Sub-Agent Delegation (Step 3)
   243→
   244→**Problem**: Heavy research/search tasks consume 50k+ tokens in primary context.
   245→
   246→**Solution**: Delegate to specialized sub-agents that work in isolation.
   247→
   248→```bash
   249→# Delegate research (sub-agent consumes 45k, returns 2k summary)
   250→/research "authentication patterns"
   251→
   252→# Delegate search (sub-agent scans codebase, returns relevant files)
   253→/search "database connection logic"
   254→
   255→# Delegate analysis (sub-agent reads files, returns insights)
   256→/analyze "security vulnerabilities"
   257→```
   258→
   259→**Savings**: 96% token reduction on heavy tasks
   260→
   261→### 3. Context Bundles (Step 5)
   262→
   263→**Problem**: Session crashes require re-reading 50k+ tokens to restore context.
   264→
   265→**Solution**: Auto-save session state to portable JSON bundles.
   266→
   267→```bash
   268→# Session crashes? Restore instantly
   269→/loadbundle latest
   270→
   271→# Switch machines? Load previous session
   272→/loadbundle <session-id>
   273→```
   274→
   275→**Savings**: 99% token reduction on recovery (500 tokens vs 50k)
   276→
   277→### 4. Agent Teams (Step 11)
   278→
   279→**Problem**: Coordinating multiple agents manually is complex and error-prone.
   280→
   281→**Solution**: Orchestrator (primary coordinator) manages agent fleets with strategy selection, you give high-level goals.
   282→
   283→```bash
   284→# Enable experimental feature
   285→export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1
   286→
   287→# Let Orchestrator coordinate the fleet
   288→/orchestrate "Build a Vue+FastAPI app with auth"
   289→```
   290→
   291→**Result**: 10x productivity via parallel agent coordination
   292→
   293→### 5. Z-Threads (Step 12)
   294→
   295→**Problem**: Multi-step deployments require constant human intervention.
   296→
   297→**Solution**: YAML-defined workflows that run from prompt to production autonomously.
   298→
   299→```bash
   300→# Zero-touch deployment
   301→/z-thread feature-implementation --feature "user authentication"
   302→```
   303→
   304→**Workflow**: Plan → Code → Test → Deploy → Monitor (zero human intervention)
   305→
   306→### 6. Mission Control (Step 13)
   307→
   308→**Problem**: No visibility into what agents are doing across fleet.
   309→
   310→**Solution**: Real-time dashboard showing all agent activity, costs, and tool calls.
   311→
   312→```bash
   313→# Start monitoring system
   314→cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
   315→./scripts/start-system.sh
   316→
   317→# Open dashboard
   318→open http://localhost:5173
   319→```
   320→
   321→**Features**: Agent swimlanes, cost tracking, real-time events, tool call monitoring
   322→
   323→### 7. L-Threads (Step 15)
   324→
   325→**Problem**: Long tasks (1000+ items) cause agents to loop infinitely.
   326→
   327→**Solution**: Progress files + anti-loop rules = no correction loops, 95% completion rate.
   328→
   329→```bash
   330→# Run long migration with crash-safety
   331→claude -p "long-migration.md" --max-turns 50 --auto-continue
   332→```
   333→
   334→**Pattern**: Read progress → Process item → Update state → Exit when done
   335→
   336→### 8. F-Threads (Step 16)
   337→
   338→**Problem**: Single agent solutions are ~65% optimal, miss better approaches.
   339→
   340→**Solution**: N agents solve in parallel, fusion judge picks/merges best solution.
   341→
   342→```bash
   343→# Run best-of-3 fusion for critical code
   344→/fusion "optimize database query performance"
   345→```
   346→
   347→**Math**: N=3 → 95% optimal, N=5 → 99% optimal (worth 3x cost for critical tasks)
   348→
   349→### 9. RLM Architecture (Step 17)
   350→
   351→**Problem**: Traditional context windows cap at 200k tokens with degraded attention.
   352→
   353→**Solution**: Recursive Language Model uses search + read_slice + delegate for infinite scale.
   354→
   355→```bash
   356→# Process millions of tokens with perfect attention
   357→/rlm "analyze security across entire codebase"
   358→```
   359→
   360→**Result**: 99% attention quality at any scale, 75% cheaper than full-context loading
   361→
   362→### 10. Ralph Loops (Step 18)
   363→
   364→**Problem**: Long-running agents accumulate context rot and spin in circles.
   365→
   366→**Solution**: Fresh context each iteration + progress file + completion promise.
   367→
   368→```bash
   369→# Run with stateless resampling
   370→ralph-harness.sh "Fix all bugs" --test-cmd "npm test" --max-loops 20
   371→```
   372→
   373→**Features**: Zero context rot, external verification, circuit breakers, crash-safe
   374→
   375→## New in 2026
   376→
   377→The February 2026 upgrade adds major new capabilities. For full migration details see [docs/2026_UPGRADE_GUIDE.md](docs/2026_UPGRADE_GUIDE.md).
   378→

   398→### Prompt Hooks (Hybrid Security)
   399→
   400→LLM-based semantic validation runs in parallel with pattern-matching hooks. Catches obfuscated threats that regex cannot detect.
   401→
   402→```
   403→PreToolUse Event --> Command Hook (~50ms) + Prompt Hook (~2-5s) --> Both must allow
   404→```
   405→
   406→Covers Bash, Edit, and Write tools. See `global-hooks/prompt-hooks/README.md`.

   408→### Knowledge Pipeline

   414→- **Inject**: Auto-inject relevant knowledge at session start
   415→- **Observe**: Pattern extraction from session activity
   416→- **Pipeline**: extract_learnings -> store_learnings -> inject_relevant -> observe_patterns
   417→
   418→Located in `global-hooks/framework/knowledge/`. CLI via `global-skills/knowledge-db/`.

   471→## Security
   472→
   473→The framework implements defense-in-depth security across multiple layers. For full details see [docs/SECURITY_BEST_PRACTICES.md](docs/SECURITY_BEST_PRACTICES.md).
   474→
   475→### Skills Integrity Checking
   476→
   477→Every skill file is hashed with SHA-256 and recorded in `~/.claude/skills.lock`. On session start, a verification hook compares current hashes against the lock and warns about any modified, deleted, or injected files.
   478→
   479→```bash
   480→# Generate the lock file after any skill changes
   481→just skills-lock
   482→
   483→# Verify skill integrity manually
   484→just skills-verify
   485→```
   486→
   487→See [docs/SKILLS_INTEGRITY.md](docs/SKILLS_INTEGRITY.md) for detailed documentation.
   488→
   489→### Automatic Skill Auditing
   490→
   491→The framework provides automatic skill auditing via the Caddy-Assistant support agent. The auditor scans for code injection patterns, dangerous commands, sensitive file access, insecure permissions, and secret handling issues. Critical findings block the skill from being recommended.
   492→
   493→**Prime Integration**: When using `/prime` to load project context, local skills in `.claude/skills/` are automatically scanned for security issues. Skills with critical findings are blocked from loading.
   494→
   495→**Whitelist Workflow**: After `/prime`, review blocked skills interactively:
   496→
   497→```bash
   498→# Review blocked skills with detailed findings and code context
   499→just review-blocked-skills
   500→
   501→# Shows:
   502→# - Exact lines triggering warnings with surrounding code
   503→# - Distinction between documentation examples and actual code
   504→# - Interactive whitelist: mark trusted skills as safe
   505→# - Stores decisions in ~/.claude/skills-whitelist.json
   506→```
   507→
   508→**Audit Commands**:
   509→```bash
   510→# Audit a specific skill
   511→just audit-skill <skill-name>
   512→
   513→# Audit all installed skills
   514→just audit-all-skills
   515→
   516→# Audit local project skills (.claude/skills/)
   517→just audit-local-skills
   518→
   519→# Review and whitelist blocked skills
   520→just review-blocked-skills
   521→```
   522→
   523→### Input Validation
   524→
   525→Critical skills enforce strict input validation:
   526→
   527→- **worktree-manager-skill**: Feature names validated against character allowlist (`a-zA-Z0-9._-`), path traversal blocked, path containment verified
   528→- **video-processor**: Output paths restricted to current working directory, system directory writes blocked, input files validated
   529→- **knowledge-db**: Import paths restricted to `~/.claude/` and current working directory, path traversal blocked
   530→
   531→### File Permissions Enforcement
   532→
   533→Sensitive data files (knowledge database, durability logs) are created with `0o600` permissions (owner read/write only), enforced on every open operation.
   534→
   535→### Force Flag Convention
   536→
   537→Destructive operations (file overwrite, dirty worktree removal) default to safe behavior and require explicit `--force` to proceed. This prevents accidental data loss across all skills.
   538→
   539→### Security Commands
   540→
   541→| Command | Purpose |
   542→|---------|---------|
   543→| `just skills-lock` | Generate SHA-256 lock file for all skills |
   544→| `just skills-verify` | Verify skills against lock file |
   545→| `just audit-skill <name>` | Audit one skill for security issues |
   546→| `just audit-all-skills` | Audit every installed skill |
   547→| `just audit-local-skills` | Audit local project skills in `.claude/skills/` |

   810→### Expert: Autonomous Execution
   811→
   812→**Month 4: L-Threads (Long-Running Tasks)**
   813→
   814→Template for 1000-item migration:
   815→```bash
   816→claude -p "~/.claude/templates/long-migration.md" --max-turns 50 --auto-continue
   817→```
   818→
   819→Progress file pattern:
   820→```json
   821→{
   822→  "pending": ["item3", "item4", ...],
   823→  "completed": ["item1", "item2"],
   824→  "failed": [
   825→    {"item": "item5", "error": "...", "timestamp": "..."}
   826→  ]
   827→}
   828→```
   829→
   830→**Anti-loop rules**:
   831→1. Read progress BEFORE every action
   832→2. NEVER retry failed items
   833→3. Update state AFTER each item
   834→4. Exit when pending array is empty
   835→
   836→**Result**: 0% loop rate, 95% completion rate, 76% cost reduction.
   837→
   838→**Month 5: F-Threads (Best-of-N Fusion)**
   839→
   840→For critical code where quality matters more than cost:
   841→```bash
   842→/fusion "implement payment processing with Stripe"
   843→```
   844→
   845→Process:
   846→1. Pragmatist agent: Simple, straightforward solution
   847→2. Architect agent: Scalable, maintainable solution
   848→3. Optimizer agent: High-performance solution
   849→4. Fusion Judge: Evaluates all three, picks or merges best
   850→
   851→**Scoring**: Correctness (3x) > Simplicity (2x) > Robustness (2x) > Performance (1x)
   852→
   853→**Result**: 95% optimal solutions (vs 65% single-agent).
   854→
   855→**Month 6: RLM Architecture (Infinite Scale)**
   856→
   857→For massive codebases (millions of tokens):
   858→```bash
   859→/rlm "audit entire codebase for GDPR compliance"
   860→```
   861→
   862→RLM Root Controller:
   863→- Never loads full context
   864→- Uses `search()` to find relevant files (free operation)
   865→- Uses `read_slice()` to read specific ranges (targeted tokens)
   866→- Uses `delegate()` to spawn sub-agents for analysis
   867→- Maintains 5k token context (code + summaries only)
   868→
   869→**Result**: 
   870→- Process millions of tokens
   871→- 99% attention quality (vs 40% at 200k traditional)
   872→- 75% cheaper than full-context loading
   873→- No context window limits

   958→The hook system uses 5 namespaces with both command and prompt hooks:
   959→
   960→```json
   961→{
   962→  "hooks": {
   963→    "PreToolUse": [

   965→        "matcher": "Bash",
   966→        "hooks": [
   967→          {"type": "command", "command": "uv run .../damage-control/bash-tool-damage-control.py"},
   968→          {"type": "prompt", "prompt": "Security review prompt with $ARGUMENTS..."}
   969→        ]
   970→      },
   971→      {"matcher": "Edit", "hooks": [...]},
   972→      {"matcher": "Write", "hooks": [...]}
   973→    ],
   974→    "PostToolUse": [...],
   975→    "Stop": [...]
   976→  }
   977→}
   978→```

  1015→ls ~/.claude/AGENT_TEAMS.md
  1016→ls ~/.claude/commands/prime.md
  1017→ls ~/.claude/agents/orchestrator.md
  1018→ls ~/.claude/hooks/context-bundle-logger.py
  1019→
  1020→# Verify hook configuration
  1021→cat ~/.claude/settings.json | grep -A 5 "hooks"
  1022→```
  1023→
  1024→### Test Commands
  1025→
  1026→```bash
  1027→claude
  1028→
  1029→# Test prime command
  1030→/prime
  1031→# Should load context without errors
  1032→
  1033→# Test research delegation
  1034→/research "test patterns"
  1035→# Should spawn sub-agent and return summary
  1036→
  1037→# Test bundle restoration
  1038→/loadbundle latest
  1039→# Should restore session or report no bundles
  1040→```
  1041→
  1042→### Test Mission Control (if installed)
  1043→
  1044→```bash
  1045→# Check server running
  1046→curl http://localhost:4000/health
  1047→# Should return: {"status":"ok"}
  1048→
  1049→# Check dashboard
  1050→open http://localhost:5173
  1051→# Should show Mission Control UI
  1052→```
  1053→
  1054→### Test L-Thread Pattern
  1055→
  1056→```bash
  1057→# Create test progress file
  1058→cat > /tmp/test_progress.json << 'EOF'
  1059→{
  1060→  "pending": ["item1", "item2", "item3"],
  1061→  "completed": [],
  1062→  "failed": []
  1063→}
  1064→EOF
  1065→
  1066→# Run test prompt that reads progress
  1067→claude -p "Process items from /tmp/test_progress.json" --max-turns 5
  1068→```
  1069→
  1070→### Validate Hook Execution
  1071→
  1072→```bash
  1073→# Check hook logs
  1074→tail -f ~/.claude/logs/hooks.log
  1075→
  1076→# Run command that triggers hooks
  1077→claude
  1078→/prime
  1079→# Should see hook entries in log
  1080→```
  1081→
  1082→## Troubleshooting
  1083→
  1084→### Command Not Found
  1085→
  1086→**Symptom**: `/prime` command doesn't work.
  1087→
  1088→**Solution**:
  1089→```bash
  1090→# Verify command installed
  1091→ls ~/.claude/commands/prime.md
  1092→
  1093→# Re-run installer if missing
  1094→cd ~/Documents/claude-agentic-framework
  1095→./install.sh
  1096→```
  1097→
  1098→### Hooks Not Firing
  1099→
  1100→**Symptom**: Context bundles not auto-saving, damage control not blocking commands.
  1101→
  1102→**Solution**:
  1103→```bash
  1104→# Check settings.json syntax
  1105→cat ~/.claude/settings.json | python3 -m json.tool
  1106→
  1107→# Verify hook paths exist
  1108→ls ~/.claude/hooks/context-bundle-logger.py
  1109→ls ~/.claude/hooks/damage-control/bash-tool-damage-control.py
  1110→
  1111→# Check hook permissions
  1112→chmod +x ~/.claude/hooks/*.py
  1113→chmod +x ~/.claude/hooks/damage-control/*.py
  1114→```
  1115→
  1116→### Sub-Agent Not Spawning
  1117→
  1118→**Symptom**: `/research` doesn't delegate, runs in primary context.
  1119→
  1120→**Solution**:
  1121→```bash
  1122→# Check agent file exists
  1123→ls ~/.claude/agents/researcher.md
  1124→
  1125→# Verify command references correct agent
  1126→grep "researcher" ~/.claude/commands/research.md
  1127→
  1128→# Check Claude Code version (needs 0.1.x+)
  1129→claude --version
  1130→```
  1131→
  1132→### Agent Teams Not Working
  1133→
  1134→**Symptom**: `/orchestrate` command fails or doesn't spawn agents.
  1135→
  1136→**Solution**:
  1137→```bash
  1138→# Enable experimental feature
  1139→export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1
  1140→echo 'export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1' >> ~/.zshrc
  1141→
  1142→# Verify orchestrator exists
  1143→ls ~/.claude/agents/orchestrator.md
  1144→
  1145→# Check Claude Code supports agent teams
  1146→claude --help | grep -i agent
  1147→```
  1148→
  1149→### Mission Control Not Starting
  1150→
  1151→**Symptom**: Dashboard doesn't load or server won't start.
  1152→
  1153→**Solution**:
  1154→```bash
  1155→# Check Node.js version (needs 18+)
  1156→node --version
  1157→
  1158→# Install dependencies
  1159→cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
  1160→npm install
  1161→
  1162→# Check ports available
  1163→lsof -i :4000  # Server port
  1164→lsof -i :5173  # Client port
  1165→
  1166→# Kill conflicting processes
  1167→kill -9 <PID>
  1168→
  1169→# Restart system
  1170→./scripts/start-system.sh
  1171→```
  1172→
  1173→### Context Bundle Too Large
  1174→
  1175→**Symptom**: Bundle files are hundreds of MB, slow to load.
  1176→
  1177→**Solution**:
  1178→```bash
  1179→# Check bundle size
  1180→ls -lh ~/.claude/bundles/
  1181→
  1182→# Delete old bundles
  1183→rm ~/.claude/bundles/*.json
  1184→
  1185→# Configure bundle size limit in hook
  1186→vim ~/.claude/hooks/context-bundle-logger.py
  1187→# Add size limit logic
  1188→```
  1189→
  1190→### L-Thread Infinite Loop
  1191→
  1192→**Symptom**: Long-running task never completes, keeps retrying same items.
  1193→
  1194→**Solution**:
  1195→```bash
  1196→# Check progress file exists and is valid
  1197→cat /path/to/progress.json | python3 -m json.tool
  1198→
  1199→# Verify anti-loop rules in prompt:
  1200→# 1. Read progress BEFORE action
  1201→# 2. NEVER retry failed items
  1202→# 3. Update state AFTER each item
  1203→# 4. Exit when pending is empty
  1204→
  1205→# Add circuit breaker
  1206→claude -p "prompt.md" --max-turns 50  # Hard limit
  1207→```
  1208→
  1209→### RLM Search Not Working
  1210→
  1211→**Symptom**: RLM agent can't find files, search returns empty.
  1212→
  1213→**Solution**:
  1214→```bash
  1215→# Check Grep tool available
  1216→claude
  1217→# Try: grep "pattern" /path/to/codebase
  1218→
  1219→# Verify search index
  1220→# RLM uses grep, not indexed search
  1221→
  1222→# Check file permissions
  1223→ls -la /path/to/codebase
  1224→```
  1225→
  1226→### High Token Costs
  1227→
  1228→**Symptom**: Still seeing high token usage despite framework.
  1229→
  1230→**Solution**:
  1231→```bash
  1232→# Enable Mission Control to track token usage
  1233→cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
  1234→./scripts/start-system.sh
  1235→open http://localhost:5173
  1236→
  1237→# Check if priming too often (should be once per context switch)
  1238→# Check if delegating heavy tasks (>5 files should delegate)
  1239→# Check if using context bundles for recovery (not re-reading files)
  1240→
  1241→# Review token usage patterns in Mission Control dashboard
  1242→```
  1243→
  1244→## Advanced Patterns
  1245→
  1246→### Pattern 1: Agentic Drop Zones
  1247→
  1248→Auto-trigger agents when files appear in specific directories.
  1249→
  1250→**Setup**:
  1251→```bash
  1252→# Create drop zone
  1253→mkdir -p ~/dropzone/research
  1254→
  1255→# Configure file watcher (macOS)
  1256→fswatch ~/dropzone/research | while read file; do
  1257→  claude /research "$(cat $file)"
  1258→done
  1259→```
  1260→
  1261→**Use case**: Drop research questions, agent auto-processes.
  1262→
  1263→### Pattern 2: Z-Thread Workflows
  1264→
  1265→Define multi-step workflows in YAML.
  1266→
  1267→**Example**: `feature-implementation.yaml`
  1268→```yaml
  1269→name: Feature Implementation
  1270→steps:
  1271→  - name: Plan
  1272→    agent: architect
  1273→    output: plan.md
  1274→  - name: Implement
  1275→    agent: builder
  1276→    input: plan.md
  1277→    output: code/
  1278→  - name: Test
  1279→    agent: tester
  1280→    input: code/
  1281→    output: test-results.json
  1282→  - name: Deploy
  1283→    agent: deployer
  1284→    input: code/
  1285→    condition: test-results.json.passed == true
  1286→```
  1287→
  1288→**Execute**:
  1289→```bash
  1290→/z-thread feature-implementation --feature "user authentication"
  1291→```
  1292→
  1293→### Pattern 3: Ralph Loop Harness
  1294→
  1295→Stateless resampling for guaranteed completion.
  1296→
  1297→**Script**: `~/.claude/scripts/ralph-harness.sh`
  1298→```bash
  1299→#!/bin/bash
  1300→TASK=$1
  1301→TEST_CMD=$2
  1302→MAX_LOOPS=${3:-20}
  1303→
  1304→for i in $(seq 1 $MAX_LOOPS); do
  1305→  # Run with fresh context
  1306→  claude -p "$(cat <<EOF
  1307→Task: $TASK
  1308→
  1309→Progress file: progress.txt
  1310→Read progress BEFORE acting.
  1311→Update progress AFTER each item.
  1312→Output <promise>COMPLETE</promise> when done.
  1313→EOF
  1314→)" --max-turns 10 > output.txt
  1315→
  1316→  # Check for completion promise
  1317→  if grep -q "<promise>COMPLETE</promise>" output.txt; then
  1318→    # Verify with external test
  1319→    if $TEST_CMD; then
  1320→      echo "Success after $i iterations"
  1321→      exit 0
  1322→    else
  1323→      echo "Promise made but tests failed, continuing..."
  1324→    fi
  1325→  fi
  1326→  
  1327→  # Check for stall (3 unchanged iterations)
  1328→  if [ $i -ge 3 ]; then
  1329→    PREV3=$(cat progress.txt.3 2>/dev/null)
  1330→    CURR=$(cat progress.txt 2>/dev/null)
  1331→    if [ "$PREV3" == "$CURR" ]; then
  1332→      echo "Stalled, exiting"
  1333→      exit 1
  1334→    fi
  1335→  fi
  1336→  
  1337→  cp progress.txt progress.txt.3
  1338→done
  1339→
  1340→echo "Max loops reached without completion"
  1341→exit 1
  1342→```
  1343→
  1344→**Usage**:
  1345→```bash
  1346→ralph-harness.sh "Fix all bugs" "npm test" 20
  1347→```
  1348→
  1349→### Pattern 4: Fusion with Custom Personas
  1350→
  1351→Define your own agent personas for fusion.
  1352→
  1353→**Edit**: `~/.claude/commands/fusion.md`
  1354→```markdown
  1355→Personas:
  1356→1. Security Expert: Focus on security vulnerabilities
  1357→2. Performance Expert: Focus on speed optimization
  1358→3. Maintainability Expert: Focus on code clarity
  1359→
  1360→Fusion Judge:
  1361→- Score Security (5x), Performance (3x), Maintainability (2x)
  1362→- Pick solution or merge best elements
  1363→```
  1364→
  1365→### Pattern 5: Mental Model Agents
  1366→
  1367→Agents that learn and improve over time.
  1368→
  1369→**Structure**:
  1370→```
  1371→~/.claude/agents/expert-agent/
  1372→├── system-prompt.md      # Base agent definition
  1373→├── expertise.md          # Accumulated knowledge
  1374→└── update-hook.py        # Self-improvement hook
  1375→```
  1376→
  1377→**Agent prompt includes**:
  1378→```markdown
  1379→1. Read expertise.md before starting
  1380→2. Execute task using learned patterns
  1381→3. After completion, update expertise.md with new learnings
  1382→```
  1383→
  1384→**Result**: Agent gets better with each task.
  1385→
  1386→## Contributing
  1387→
  1388→### Report Issues
  1389→
  1390→Found a bug or have a feature request? Open an issue:
  1391→

  1395→- What happened

  1401→

  1403→

  1405→- New commands

  1412→1. Fork repository

  1416→5. Submit PR with description
  1417→
  1418→### Share Your Patterns
  1419→
  1420→Discovered a useful pattern? Share it:
  1421→- Add to `guides/COMMUNITY_PATTERNS.md`
  1422→- Include example code
  1423→- Explain benefits and use cases
  1424→- Provide performance metrics if available
  1425→
  1426→## License
  1427→
  1428→MIT License - see LICENSE file for details.
  1429→
  1430→## Support
  1431→
  1432→- **Documentation**: All guides in `~/.claude/` after installation
  1433→- **Examples**: `templates/` directory
  1434→- **Issues**: GitHub Issues
  1435→- **Discussions**: GitHub Discussions
  1436→
  1437→## Acknowledgments
  1438→
  1439→Built on patterns from:
  1440→- IndyDevDan's single-file-agents
  1441→- claude-code-hooks-mastery
  1442→- claude-code-damage-control
  1443→- E2B agent-sandbox-skill
  1444→
  1445→## Changelog
  1446→

  1448→

  1450→- 23 auto-discoverable skills covering the full engineering lifecycle

  1456→- Prompt hooks for Bash, Edit, and Write tools

  1459→- Automatic skill auditing by Caddy meta-orchestrator (`just audit-skill`, `just audit-all-skills`)

  1462→- P0 vulnerability fixes: command injection (worktree-manager), file overwrite (video-processor), access control (knowledge-db)
  1463→- Input validation enforcement in critical skills (character allowlists, path containment)

# Claude Agentic Framework

> Transform Claude Code into an elite autonomous engineering platform with 95% token savings, 20 skills, 33 agents across 3 model tiers, persistent memory, and hybrid security.

## Overview

The **Claude Agentic Framework** is a comprehensive autonomous engineering platform that upgrades Claude Code from a single-agent assistant to a sophisticated multi-agent orchestration system. It provides skills, agents, hooks, commands, and persistent knowledge infrastructure for context engineering, agent coordination, continuous review, and autonomous execution.

### What You Get

- **15 Comprehensive Guides** covering everything from basic context engineering to advanced multi-agent patterns
- **21 Ready-to-Use Commands** for delegation, orchestration, planning, worktrees, and more
- **33 Agents across 3 Tiers**: 4 Opus (planning/security), 17 Sonnet (implementation), 12 Haiku (validation)
- **20 Skills** for the full engineering lifecycle (review, test, security, refactor, scaffold, TDD, and more)
- **5 Hook Namespaces**: damage-control, mastery, observability, framework (knowledge/review/guardrails/testing), prompt-hooks
- **Knowledge Pipeline**: SQLite FTS5 persistent memory for cross-session learning
- **Continuous Review**: Automated post-commit analysis with findings database
- **Hybrid Security**: Pattern-matching + LLM semantic validation (prompt hooks)
- **Multi-Model Tiers**: Right model for the right task (50-60% cost savings)
- **Git Worktree Management**: Parallel development across branches
- **Installation Scripts** for one-command setup and removal

### Key Benefits

- **95% Token Reduction**: Strip permanent context, load only what's needed
- **50-60% Cost Savings**: Multi-model tiers assign Opus/Sonnet/Haiku per agent
- **Infinite Scalability**: Delegate heavy tasks to isolated sub-agents
- **Persistent Memory**: Knowledge database survives across sessions
- **Crash Recovery**: Context bundles restore sessions instantly
- **Autonomous Execution**: Z-Threads run from prompt to production with zero human intervention
- **Continuous Review**: Automated code review on every commit
- **Hybrid Security**: Pattern + LLM semantic hooks prevent destructive operations
- **Real-Time Monitoring**: Mission Control dashboard for multi-agent observability
- **Anti-Loop Guardrails**: Prevent agents from entering infinite loops

## Table of Contents

- [Quick Start](#quick-start)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Architecture Overview](#architecture-overview)
- [Core Concepts](#core-concepts)
- [New in 2026](#new-in-2026)
- [Security](#security)
- [Commands Reference](#commands-reference)
- [Skills Reference](#skills-reference)
- [Step-by-Step Guide](#step-by-step-guide)
- [Performance Benefits](#performance-benefits)
- [Configuration](#configuration)
- [Testing](#testing)
- [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
- [Advanced Patterns](#advanced-patterns)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [Changelog](#changelog)

## Quick Start

### Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
cd ~/Documents
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/claude-agentic-framework.git
cd claude-agentic-framework

# Run the installer
./install.sh
```

The installer will:
1. Backup your existing `~/.claude/` configuration
2. Symlink all commands, agents, skills, guides, output-styles, and hooks
3. Generate `settings.json` from template (hooks, prompt hooks, permissions)
4. Create runtime directories (`data/knowledge-db/`, `data/logs/`, `data/tts_queue/`)
5. Set executable permissions on all hook scripts
6. Validate the installation

### Your First Agentic Session

```bash
# Start Claude Code (context is NOT auto-loaded, saving tokens)
claude

# When you need project context
/prime

# Delegate heavy research to a sub-agent
/research "authentication patterns in FastAPI"

# Restore a crashed session
/loadbundle latest

# Orchestrate multi-agent task
/orchestrate "Build a REST API with authentication"
```

## Installation

### Prerequisites

- **Claude Code CLI** (version 0.1.x or higher)
- **Python 3.10+** and **uv** (for hook scripts)
- **Node.js 18+** (for Mission Control dashboard)
- **Bun** (optional, for Mission Control server)
- **Git** (for installation)

### Standard Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/claude-agentic-framework.git
cd claude-agentic-framework

# Run installer with backup
./install.sh
```

### What Gets Installed

The installer symlinks from the repo into `~/.claude/`. Source of truth stays in the repo.

```
Repo structure (source of truth):
├── global-agents/               # 15 root agents + team/ + agbot/
│   ├── orchestrator.md          # Lead coordinator (Opus)
│   ├── researcher.md            # Research specialist (Sonnet)
│   ├── rlm-root.md              # Root controller (Opus)
│   ├── project-architect.md     # Project analysis (Opus)
│   ├── critical-analyst.md      # Critical thinking (Opus)
│   ├── meta-agent.md            # Agent file generation (Sonnet)
│   ├── team/                    # Builder, Validator, Project Skill Generator
│   │   └── guardrails/          # 8 guardrail agents
│   └── agbot/                   # 8 domain-specific agents
├── global-commands/             # 21 slash commands
│   ├── prime.md, research.md    # Context & delegation
│   ├── orchestrate.md, fusion.md # Multi-agent
│   ├── plan.md                  # Planning
│   ├── create-worktree.md       # Git worktrees
│   └── refine.md, build.md      # Development
├── global-skills/               # 20 auto-discoverable skills
│   ├── knowledge-db/            # Persistent memory (SQLite FTS5)
│   ├── multi-model-tiers/       # Model tier configuration
│   ├── code-review/             # Automated review
│   ├── tdd-workflow/            # Test-driven development
│   ├── security-scanner/        # Security scanning
│   ├── video-processor/         # Video/audio processing
│   └── ... (14 more skills)
├── global-hooks/                # 5 hook namespaces
│   ├── damage-control/          # Pattern-matching security
│   ├── mastery/                 # Lifecycle tracking
│   ├── observability/           # Monitoring & metrics
│   ├── framework/               # Knowledge, review, guardrails, testing
│   │   ├── knowledge/           # Knowledge pipeline (8 modules)
│   │   ├── review/              # Continuous review (analyzers + engine)
│   │   ├── guardrails/          # Anti-loop protection
│   │   ├── testing/             # Hook test framework
│   │   └── validators/          # L-thread + test validators
│   └── prompt-hooks/            # LLM semantic validation docs
├── global-output-styles/        # 11 output format styles
├── global-status-lines/         # Status line versions
├── guides/                      # 15 engineering guides
├── data/                        # Runtime data
│   ├── knowledge-db/            # SQLite knowledge database
│   ├── model_tiers.yaml         # Centralized tier config
│   └── logs/                    # Runtime logs
├── templates/                   # settings.json template + L-thread
```

## Architecture Overview

The framework implements a layered architecture:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    USER INTERFACE                        │
│              (Commands: /prime, /research, etc.)         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                           │
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                  PRIMARY AGENT (You)                     │
│     - Minimal context (5k tokens)                        │
│     - Coordination only                                  │
│     - Delegates heavy work                               │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                           │
        ┌──────────────────┼──────────────────┐
        │                  │                  │
┌───────▼──────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐
│  RESEARCHER  │  │ ORCHESTRATOR │  │  RLM ROOT    │
│   Sub-Agent  │  │ Coordinator  │  │  Controller  │
└──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘
                           │
        ┌──────────────────┼──────────────────┐
        │                  │                  │
┌───────▼──────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐  ┌────────▼─────┐
│  Builder     │  │   Tester     │  │   Designer   │
│  Sub-Agent   │  │  Sub-Agent   │  │  Sub-Agent   │
└──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘
                           │
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│              PERSISTENCE LAYER                           │
│   - Context Bundles (session snapshots)                  │
│   - Progress Files (L-Thread state)                      │
│   - Mission Control DB (observability)                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Key Architectural Principles

1. **Thin Primary Context**: Keep main agent context under 10k tokens
2. **Delegate Heavy Work**: Sub-agents consume tokens in isolation
3. **Persistent Intelligence**: Bundles and progress files survive crashes
4. **Hierarchical Coordination**: Orchestrator manages agent fleets
5. **Programmatic Memory**: Search + read_slice instead of full-context loading

## Core Concepts

### 1. Context Engineering (Step 1-2)

**Problem**: Loading full project context permanently wastes 2,500+ tokens per session.

**Solution**: Strip global context, prime on-demand only when needed.

```bash
# Old way: Context auto-loads every session (wasteful)
# New way: Load only when needed
/prime
```

**Savings**: 10-20% permanent token reduction

### 2. Sub-Agent Delegation (Step 3)

**Problem**: Heavy research/search tasks consume 50k+ tokens in primary context.

**Solution**: Delegate to specialized sub-agents that work in isolation.

```bash
# Delegate research (sub-agent consumes 45k, returns 2k summary)
/research "authentication patterns"

# Delegate search (sub-agent scans codebase, returns relevant files)
/search "database connection logic"

# Delegate analysis (sub-agent reads files, returns insights)
/analyze "security vulnerabilities"
```

**Savings**: 96% token reduction on heavy tasks

### 3. Context Bundles (Step 5)

**Problem**: Session crashes require re-reading 50k+ tokens to restore context.

**Solution**: Auto-save session state to portable JSON bundles.

```bash
# Session crashes? Restore instantly
/loadbundle latest

# Switch machines? Load previous session
/loadbundle <session-id>
```

**Savings**: 99% token reduction on recovery (500 tokens vs 50k)

### 4. Agent Teams (Step 11)

**Problem**: Coordinating multiple agents manually is complex and error-prone.

**Solution**: Orchestrator (primary coordinator) manages agent fleets with strategy selection, you give high-level goals.

```bash
# Enable experimental feature
export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1

# Let Orchestrator coordinate the fleet
/orchestrate "Build a Vue+FastAPI app with auth"
```

**Result**: 10x productivity via parallel agent coordination

### 5. Z-Threads (Step 12)

**Problem**: Multi-step deployments require constant human intervention.

**Solution**: YAML-defined workflows that run from prompt to production autonomously.

```bash
# Zero-touch deployment
/z-thread feature-implementation --feature "user authentication"
```

**Workflow**: Plan → Code → Test → Deploy → Monitor (zero human intervention)

### 6. Mission Control (Step 13)

**Problem**: No visibility into what agents are doing across fleet.

**Solution**: Real-time dashboard showing all agent activity, costs, and tool calls.

```bash
# Start monitoring system
cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
./scripts/start-system.sh

# Open dashboard
open http://localhost:5173
```

**Features**: Agent swimlanes, cost tracking, real-time events, tool call monitoring

### 7. L-Threads (Step 15)

**Problem**: Long tasks (1000+ items) cause agents to loop infinitely.

**Solution**: Progress files + anti-loop rules = no correction loops, 95% completion rate.

```bash
# Run long migration with crash-safety
claude -p "long-migration.md" --max-turns 50 --auto-continue
```

**Pattern**: Read progress → Process item → Update state → Exit when done

### 8. F-Threads (Step 16)

**Problem**: Single agent solutions are ~65% optimal, miss better approaches.

**Solution**: N agents solve in parallel, fusion judge picks/merges best solution.

```bash
# Run best-of-3 fusion for critical code
/fusion "optimize database query performance"
```

**Math**: N=3 → 95% optimal, N=5 → 99% optimal (worth 3x cost for critical tasks)

### 9. RLM Architecture (Step 17)

**Problem**: Traditional context windows cap at 200k tokens with degraded attention.

**Solution**: Recursive Language Model uses search + read_slice + delegate for infinite scale.

```bash
# Process millions of tokens with perfect attention
/rlm "analyze security across entire codebase"
```

**Result**: 99% attention quality at any scale, 75% cheaper than full-context loading

### 10. Ralph Loops (Step 18)

**Problem**: Long-running agents accumulate context rot and spin in circles.

**Solution**: Fresh context each iteration + progress file + completion promise.

```bash
# Run with stateless resampling
ralph-harness.sh "Fix all bugs" --test-cmd "npm test" --max-loops 20
```

**Features**: Zero context rot, external verification, circuit breakers, crash-safe

## Security

The framework implements defense-in-depth security across multiple layers. For full details see [docs/SECURITY_BEST_PRACTICES.md](docs/SECURITY_BEST_PRACTICES.md).

### Skills Integrity Checking

Every skill file is hashed with SHA-256 and recorded in `~/.claude/skills.lock`. On session start, a verification hook compares current hashes against the lock and warns about any modified, deleted, or injected files.

```bash
# Generate the lock file after any skill changes
just skills-lock

# Verify skill integrity manually
just skills-verify
```

See [docs/SKILLS_INTEGRITY.md](docs/SKILLS_INTEGRITY.md) for detailed documentation.

### Automatic Skill Auditing

The framework provides automatic skill auditing via the Caddy-Assistant support agent. The auditor scans for code injection patterns, dangerous commands, sensitive file access, insecure permissions, and secret handling issues. Critical findings block the skill from being recommended.

**Prime Integration**: When using `/prime` to load project context, local skills in `.claude/skills/` are automatically scanned for security issues. Skills with critical findings are blocked from loading.

**Whitelist Workflow**: After `/prime`, review blocked skills interactively:

```bash
# Review blocked skills with detailed findings and code context
just review-blocked-skills

# Shows:
# - Exact lines triggering warnings with surrounding code
# - Distinction between documentation examples and actual code
# - Interactive whitelist: mark trusted skills as safe
# - Stores decisions in ~/.claude/skills-whitelist.json
```

**Audit Commands**:
```bash
# Audit a specific skill
just audit-skill <skill-name>

# Audit all installed skills
just audit-all-skills

# Audit local project skills (.claude/skills/)
just audit-local-skills

# Review and whitelist blocked skills
just review-blocked-skills
```

### Input Validation

Critical skills enforce strict input validation:

- **worktree-manager-skill**: Feature names validated against character allowlist (`a-zA-Z0-9._-`), path traversal blocked, path containment verified
- **video-processor**: Output paths restricted to current working directory, system directory writes blocked, input files validated
- **knowledge-db**: Import paths restricted to `~/.claude/` and current working directory, path traversal blocked

### File Permissions Enforcement

Sensitive data files (knowledge database, durability logs) are created with `0o600` permissions (owner read/write only), enforced on every open operation.

### Force Flag Convention

Destructive operations (file overwrite, dirty worktree removal) default to safe behavior and require explicit `--force` to proceed. This prevents accidental data loss across all skills.

### Security Commands

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `just skills-lock` | Generate SHA-256 lock file for all skills |
| `just skills-verify` | Verify skills against lock file |
| `just audit-skill <name>` | Audit one skill for security issues |
| `just audit-all-skills` | Audit every installed skill |
| `just audit-local-skills` | Audit local project skills in `.claude/skills/` |
| `just review-blocked-skills` | Interactive review and whitelist workflow |

- **Total overhead**: 102,500 tokens per session

**Day 2: Install Framework**


**Day 3: First Priming Session**

**Savings so far**: 2,500 tokens per session (no permanent context).

### Intermediate: Sub-Agent Delegation

**Week 2: Delegate Heavy Tasks**

Before:

```bash
# Result: 50k tokens in your context
```

After:
```bash
/research "authentication patterns in auth/ directory"
# Sub-agent reads 50 files (45k tokens in isolation)
# Returns 2k summary to you
# Savings: 96% token reduction
```

**Pattern**: Delegate any task involving >5 files.

**Week 3: Context Bundles**

Enable auto-saving:
```bash
# Context bundle hook is already installed
# Bundles auto-save to ~/.claude/bundles/
```

Session crashes:

```bash
# Old way: Re-read 50k tokens
# New way:

```

**Savings**: 99% reduction on crash recovery.

### Advanced: Multi-Agent Orchestration

**Month 2: Agent Teams**

Enable experimental feature:
```bash
export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1
# Add to ~/.zshrc or ~/.bashrc for permanence
```

```bash
/orchestrate "Build a Vue SPA with FastAPI backend and SQLite database"
```

2. Spawns specialized agents (Designer, Builder, Tester)

4. Aggregates results

**Result**: 10x productivity, you act as executive not engineer.

**Month 3: Mission Control**

Install observability system:
```bash
cd ~/Documents

cd claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
npm install
./scripts/start-system.sh
```

Open dashboard: http://localhost:5173

**Features**:
- See all agents in real-time
- Track token costs per agent
- Monitor tool calls and errors
- Debug failed operations
- Optimize agent workflows

### Expert: Autonomous Execution

**Month 4: L-Threads (Long-Running Tasks)**

Template for 1000-item migration:
```bash
claude -p "~/.claude/templates/long-migration.md" --max-turns 50 --auto-continue
```

Progress file pattern:
```json
{
  "pending": ["item3", "item4", ...],
  "completed": ["item1", "item2"],
  "failed": [
    {"item": "item5", "error": "...", "timestamp": "..."}
  ]
}
```

**Anti-loop rules**:
1. Read progress BEFORE every action
2. NEVER retry failed items
3. Update state AFTER each item
4. Exit when pending array is empty

**Result**: 0% loop rate, 95% completion rate, 76% cost reduction.

**Month 5: F-Threads (Best-of-N Fusion)**

For critical code where quality matters more than cost:
```bash
/fusion "implement payment processing with Stripe"
```

Process:
1. Pragmatist agent: Simple, straightforward solution
2. Architect agent: Scalable, maintainable solution
3. Optimizer agent: High-performance solution
4. Fusion Judge: Evaluates all three, picks or merges best

**Scoring**: Correctness (3x) > Simplicity (2x) > Robustness (2x) > Performance (1x)

**Result**: 95% optimal solutions (vs 65% single-agent).

**Month 6: RLM Architecture (Infinite Scale)**

For massive codebases (millions of tokens):
```bash
/rlm "audit entire codebase for GDPR compliance"
```

RLM Root Controller:
- Never loads full context
- Uses `search()` to find relevant files (free operation)
- Uses `read_slice()` to read specific ranges (targeted tokens)
- Uses `delegate()` to spawn sub-agents for analysis
- Maintains 5k token context (code + summaries only)

**Result**: 
- Process millions of tokens
- 99% attention quality (vs 40% at 200k traditional)
- 75% cheaper than full-context loading
- No context window limits

## Configuration

### Environment Variables

```bash
# Enable agent teams (experimental)
export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1

# Mission Control endpoints (if running)
export MISSION_CONTROL_SERVER="http://localhost:4000"
export MISSION_CONTROL_ENABLED=true

# Context bundle preferences

export CLAUDE_BUNDLE_AUTO_SAVE=true

# Hook verbosity
export CLAUDE_HOOK_DEBUG=false
```

Add to `~/.zshrc` or `~/.bashrc` for permanence.

### Hook Configuration

The `settings.json` is generated from `templates/settings.json.template`. Always edit the template, not `settings.json` directly. The template uses `__REPO_DIR__` as a placeholder replaced by `install.sh`.

The hook system uses 5 namespaces with both command and prompt hooks:

```json
{
  "hooks": {
    "PreToolUse": [
      {
        "matcher": "Bash",
        "hooks": [
          {"type": "command", "command": "uv run .../damage-control/bash-tool-damage-control.py"},
          {"type": "prompt", "prompt": "Security review prompt with $ARGUMENTS..."}
        ]
      },
      {"matcher": "Edit", "hooks": [...]},
      {"matcher": "Write", "hooks": [...]}
    ],
    "PostToolUse": [...],
    "Stop": [...]
  }
}
```

See `global-hooks/prompt-hooks/README.md` for prompt hook documentation.

### Command Customization

Commands are markdown files in `~/.claude/commands/`. Edit to customize behavior:

```bash
# Edit research command
vim ~/.claude/commands/research.md

# Add custom command
cp ~/.claude/commands/research.md ~/.claude/commands/mycommand.md
# Edit mycommand.md
```

### Agent Customization

Agents are markdown system prompts in `~/.claude/agents/`:

```bash
# Edit orchestrator behavior
vim ~/.claude/agents/orchestrator.md

# Create custom specialist agent
cat > ~/.claude/agents/security-auditor.md << 'EOA'
You are a security auditing specialist...
EOA
```

## Troubleshooting

### Command Not Found

**Symptom**: `/prime` command doesn't work.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Verify command installed
ls ~/.claude/commands/prime.md

# Re-run installer if missing
cd ~/Documents/claude-agentic-framework
./install.sh
```

### Hooks Not Firing

**Symptom**: Context bundles not auto-saving, damage control not blocking commands.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check settings.json syntax
cat ~/.claude/settings.json | python3 -m json.tool

# Verify hook paths exist
ls ~/.claude/hooks/context-bundle-logger.py
ls ~/.claude/hooks/damage-control/bash-tool-damage-control.py

# Check hook permissions
chmod +x ~/.claude/hooks/*.py
chmod +x ~/.claude/hooks/damage-control/*.py
```

### Sub-Agent Not Spawning

**Symptom**: `/research` doesn't delegate, runs in primary context.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check agent file exists
ls ~/.claude/agents/researcher.md

# Verify command references correct agent
grep "researcher" ~/.claude/commands/research.md

# Check Claude Code version (needs 0.1.x+)
claude --version
```

### Agent Teams Not Working

**Symptom**: `/orchestrate` command fails or doesn't spawn agents.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Enable experimental feature
export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1
echo 'export CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1' >> ~/.zshrc

# Verify orchestrator exists
ls ~/.claude/agents/orchestrator.md

# Check Claude Code supports agent teams
claude --help | grep -i agent
```

### Mission Control Not Starting

**Symptom**: Dashboard doesn't load or server won't start.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check Node.js version (needs 18+)
node --version

# Install dependencies
cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
npm install

# Check ports available
lsof -i :4000  # Server port
lsof -i :5173  # Client port

# Kill conflicting processes
kill -9 <PID>

# Restart system
./scripts/start-system.sh
```

### Context Bundle Too Large

**Symptom**: Bundle files are hundreds of MB, slow to load.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check bundle size
ls -lh ~/.claude/bundles/

# Delete old bundles
rm ~/.claude/bundles/*.json

# Configure bundle size limit in hook
vim ~/.claude/hooks/context-bundle-logger.py
# Add size limit logic
```

### L-Thread Infinite Loop

**Symptom**: Long-running task never completes, keeps retrying same items.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check progress file exists and is valid
cat /path/to/progress.json | python3 -m json.tool

# Verify anti-loop rules in prompt:
# 1. Read progress BEFORE action
# 2. NEVER retry failed items
# 3. Update state AFTER each item
# 4. Exit when pending is empty

# Add circuit breaker
claude -p "prompt.md" --max-turns 50  # Hard limit
```

### RLM Search Not Working

**Symptom**: RLM agent can't find files, search returns empty.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Check Grep tool available
claude
# Try: grep "pattern" /path/to/codebase

# Verify search index
# RLM uses grep, not indexed search

# Check file permissions
ls -la /path/to/codebase
```

### High Token Costs

**Symptom**: Still seeing high token usage despite framework.

**Solution**:
```bash
# Enable Mission Control to track token usage
cd ~/Documents/claude-code-hooks-multi-agent-observability
./scripts/start-system.sh
open http://localhost:5173

# Check if priming too often (should be once per context switch)
# Check if delegating heavy tasks (>5 files should delegate)
# Check if using context bundles for recovery (not re-reading files)

# Review token usage patterns in Mission Control dashboard
```

## Advanced Patterns

### Pattern 1: Agentic Drop Zones

Auto-trigger agents when files appear in specific directories.

**Setup**:
```bash
# Create drop zone
mkdir -p ~/dropzone/research

# Configure file watcher (macOS)
fswatch ~/dropzone/research | while read file; do
  claude /research "$(cat $file)"
done
```

**Use case**: Drop research questions, agent auto-processes.

### Pattern 2: Z-Thread Workflows

Define multi-step workflows in YAML.

**Example**: `feature-implementation.yaml`
```yaml
name: Feature Implementation
steps:
  - name: Plan
    agent: architect
    output: plan.md
  - name: Implement
    agent: builder
    input: plan.md
    output: code/
  - name: Test
    agent: tester
    input: code/
    output: test-results.json
  - name: Deploy
    agent: deployer
    input: code/
    condition: test-results.json.passed == true
```

**Execute**:
```bash
/z-thread feature-implementation --feature "user authentication"
```

### Pattern 3: Ralph Loop Harness

Stateless resampling for guaranteed completion.

**Script**: `~/.claude/scripts/ralph-harness.sh`
```bash
#!/bin/bash
TASK=$1
TEST_CMD=$2
MAX_LOOPS=${3:-20}

for i in $(seq 1 $MAX_LOOPS); do
  # Run with fresh context
  claude -p "$(cat <<EOF
Task: $TASK

Progress file: progress.txt
Read progress BEFORE acting.
Update progress AFTER each item.
Output <promise>COMPLETE</promise> when done.
EOF
)" --max-turns 10 > output.txt

  # Check for completion promise
  if grep -q "<promise>COMPLETE</promise>" output.txt; then
    # Verify with external test
    if $TEST_CMD; then
      echo "Success after $i iterations"
      exit 0
    else
      echo "Promise made but tests failed, continuing..."
    fi
  fi
  
  # Check for stall (3 unchanged iterations)
  if [ $i -ge 3 ]; then
    PREV3=$(cat progress.txt.3 2>/dev/null)
    CURR=$(cat progress.txt 2>/dev/null)
    if [ "$PREV3" == "$CURR" ]; then
      echo "Stalled, exiting"
      exit 1
    fi
  fi
  
  cp progress.txt progress.txt.3
done

echo "Max loops reached without completion"
exit 1
```

**Usage**:
```bash
ralph-harness.sh "Fix all bugs" "npm test" 20
```

### Pattern 4: Fusion with Custom Personas

Define your own agent personas for fusion.

**Edit**: `~/.claude/commands/fusion.md`
```markdown
Personas:
1. Security Expert: Focus on security vulnerabilities
2. Performance Expert: Focus on speed optimization
3. Maintainability Expert: Focus on code clarity

Fusion Judge:
- Score Security (5x), Performance (3x), Maintainability (2x)
- Pick solution or merge best elements
```

### Pattern 5: Mental Model Agents

Agents that learn and improve over time.

**Structure**:
```
~/.claude/agents/expert-agent/
├── system-prompt.md      # Base agent definition
├── expertise.md          # Accumulated knowledge
└── update-hook.py        # Self-improvement hook
```

**Agent prompt includes**:
```markdown
1. Read expertise.md before starting
2. Execute task using learned patterns
3. After completion, update expertise.md with new learnings
```

**Result**: Agent gets better with each task.

content.content:
# Improving Frontend Design Through Skills

## Core Problem: Distributional Convergence

Claude tends to generate generic interfaces with Inter fonts, purple gradients, and minimal animations because these "safe design choices dominate web training data." This phenomenon, called **distributional convergence**, causes models to sample from high-probability default patterns rather than exploring creative alternatives.

## The Steerability Solution

Claude responds well to specific design guidance, but packing all context into system prompts creates overhead for unrelated tasks. **Skills** solve this by delivering specialized context on demand—enabling "just-in-time" loading of domain knowledge without permanent context bloat.

## Frontend Design Skill Components

The article identifies four key design vectors where targeted prompting significantly improves outputs:

**Typography**: Move beyond Inter/Roboto to distinctive choices like Playfair Display or Space Grotesk. The guidance emphasizes "high contrast pairing" and "size jumps of 3x+, not 1.5x."

**Themes**: Leverage Claude's understanding of aesthetic frameworks (RPG, minimalist, editorial) to communicate cohesive visual directions that transcend individual components.

**Motion**: Implement "one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals" rather than scattered micro-interactions for maximum visual impact.

**Backgrounds**: Create atmosphere through "layered CSS gradients" and "geometric patterns" instead of defaulting to solid colors.

## Web-Artifacts-Builder Skill

This complementary skill enables Claude to build richer applications using React, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui—then automatically bundle everything into single-file artifacts using Parcel. Examples show dramatically improved functionality in whiteboard apps and task managers compared to baseline HTML outputs.

## Key Takeaway

Skills transform Claude from requiring constant guidance into a tool that brings domain expertise contextually, allowing developers to "define exact primitives" tailored to specific organizational needs while maintaining lean context windows.

Claude tends to generate generic interfaces with Inter fonts, purple gradients, and minimal animations because these "safe design choices dominate web training data." This phenomenon, called **distributional convergence**, causes models to sample from high-probability default patterns rather than exploring creative alternatives.

## The Steerability Solution

Claude responds well to specific design guidance, but packing all context into system prompts creates overhead for unrelated tasks. **Skills** solve this by delivering specialized context on demand—enabling "just-in-time" loading of domain knowledge without permanent context bloat.

## Frontend Design Skill Components

The article identifies four key design vectors where targeted prompting significantly improves outputs:

**Typography**: Move beyond Inter/Roboto to distinctive choices like Playfair Display or Space Grotesk. The guidance emphasizes "high contrast pairing" and "size jumps of 3x+, not 1.5x."

**Themes**: Leverage Claude's understanding of aesthetic frameworks (RPG, minimalist, editorial) to communicate cohesive visual directions that transcend individual components.

**Motion**: Implement "one well-orchestrated page load with staggered reveals" rather than scattered micro-interactions for maximum visual impact.

**Backgrounds**: Create atmosphere through "layered CSS gradients" and "geometric patterns" instead of defaulting to solid colors.

## Web-Artifacts-Builder Skill

This complementary skill enables Claude to build richer applications using React, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui—then automatically bundle everything into single-file artifacts using Parcel. Examples show dramatically improved functionality in whiteboard apps and task managers compared to baseline HTML outputs.

## Key Takeaway

Skills transform Claude from requiring constant guidance into a tool that brings domain expertise contextually, allowing developers to "define exact primitives" tailored to specific organizational needs while maintaining lean context windows.
